Valley School District Families,

With improving air quality, meals will be delivered on routes tomorrow, Thursday, September 17th. Meals will also be available for pick-up at the Valley School Bus Loop from 8:00 am - 1:00 pm. Thank you for your patience.

Stay Safe!

Ben Ferney

post_text:
An update from Superintendent Ben Ferney

Valley School District Families,

Due to the continuing hazardous air quality the meal delivery routes will not run on Wednesday, September 16th. Meals will be available for pick-up at the Valley School Bus Loop from 8:00 am - 1:00 pm. The meal delivery routes will begin when the air quality improves. District services will be operating as planned other than canceling the meal delivery routes.

Stay Safe!
Ben Ferney

post_text:
NOTICE is hereby given that the Board of Directors (the ‚ÄúBoard‚Äù) of Valley School District No. 70, Stevens County, Washington (the ‚ÄúDistrict‚Äù) will hold a Special Meeting beginning at 6:00 p.m. on Monday, August 17, 2020 at the Valley School District Offices, 3030 Huffman Road, Valley, Washington. Information for public access via TEAMS will be included in the board agenda that is posted on the Valley School District Website and Facebook page at least 24 hours prior to the meeting.

The purpose of the meeting is to take action on the 2020-2021 School Reopening Plan and Minimum Basic Education Requirement Compliance. Action is anticipated.

The purpose of the meeting is to take action on the 2020-2021 School Reopening Plan and Minimum Basic Education Requirement Compliance. Action is anticipated.

post_text:
Now, more than ever, reliable high-speed internet service is a necessity. The Washington State Broadband Office and Public Works Board needs help to identify low or no high-speed internet service areas ‚ÄúSolving broadband issues at the macro level is not an option ‚Äì it requires micro-surgery,‚Äù said Russ Elliott, director of the Washington State Broadband Office. ‚ÄúWe are in a time where we need the most precise data in order to make intelligent decisions with the limited state funds available. We need everyone to participate in these surveys so we have the highest quality data to make the best decisions for providing future-proof infrastructure to solve these issues not just for today, but for the next generation.‚Äù

Please take the 1-minute survey!
Access and Speed Survey:https://www.commerce.wa.gov/building-infrastructure/washington-statewide-broadband-act/

To read the full press release: https://www.commerce.wa.gov/news-releases/community-programs-facilities/state-broadband-office-needs-you-to-help-identify-low-or-no-high-speed-internet-service-areas/

June 12 at 8:37 AM ¬∑

The Valley School District and Staff would like to congratulate the Eighth Grade Graduating Students. A special recognition to Daylin Logan - Class Valedictorian and Ripley McNab - Class Salutatorian.

Class Motto: "I can accept failure; everyone fails at something. But I can't accept not Trying." Michael Jordan

Academic Excellence - Johnathan Moeller and Jessica Rindlisbacher. Academic Achievement - Lukas Lehman and Kaylise Wood

Eight Year students were: Alysia Capoeman, Dean Noe, Eli Johnson, Emily McBride, Gavin Lawrence, Landin Church, Malachi Greever and Tyler VanDoren.

post_text:
May 29, 2020 Update from Superintendent Ben Ferney

Valley School District Staff and Families,

It may be hard to believe but there are only two weeks left in this school year and our seniors will be done in one week! Thank you for hanging in there with us through our Continuous Learning model and keep pushing hard until the end. A few key dates:

‚Ä¢ Food service with delivery will run through June 18 (two meals on June 18)
‚Ä¢ Last day of school for grades K-11 is June 12
‚Ä¢ Last day of school for seniors is June 5
‚Ä¢ Paideia High School pre-graduation process is June 6

One of my biggest takeaways this spring is how important teamwork and working together is for the success of our students. Together IS better!

Take care,

Ben

post_text: Please read this post from WSU Stevens County Extension office and consider taking the speed test to help them bring better internet service to our area.
shared_text:
EXPRESSOPTIMIZER.NET
Crowd Source Main

WSU Stevens County Extension
April 29 at 5:05 PM ¬∑

Got internet?üíª
The COVID-19 pandemic has brought to the forefront the issue of rural broadand. Help us get accurate data so we can find solutions.

The Stevens County / Spokane Tribe Broadband Action Team has been chosen by the Washington State Broadband Office to launch a new, and better mapping tool. The map it creates will help us plan and apply for grants to get increased broadband to our area.

Please take this speed test from your home internet.Don‚Äôt have internet? Message us!

This data allows us to challenge the FCC records that show Stevens County as 100% served with high speed internet, and we know that‚Äôs not true.

You have the option to fill in your real address or keep it private, but the more accurate the data is the more likely we can get something done for everyone. They discard the addressing data as soon as it hits the map and don‚Äôt collect any personal information.

Please share this with your friends, family, and acquaintances in Stevens County.

text:
Valley School
April 9 at 9:04 AM ¬∑

A message from the Valley School Facilities Team.

In order to help "flatten the curve" in this time of social distancing and protection, please follow the recycling rules to help keep our staff safe.

post_text:
Valley School District Staff and Families,

As you have likely heard, Governor Inslee has extended the closure of schools for the rest of this school year. It is a good reminder that we are in the middle of a health crisis and will do everything we can to stop the spread of COVID-19. With that said, our plan is to continue running the meal service, childcare for first responders and medical professionals, and provide continuous learning. The district will receive additional information and direction from the Office of the Superintendent of Instruction (OSPI) on continuous learning. Please know, we will continue to work hard and provide the best education possible for our students.

Take care,

Ben Ferney
text:
Valley School District Staff and Families,

As you have likely heard, Governor Inslee has extended the closure of schools for the rest of this school year. It is a good reminder that we are in the middle of a health crisis and will do everything we can to stop the spread of COVID-19. With that said, our plan is to continue running the meal service, childcare for first responders and medical professionals, and provide continuous learning. The district will receive additional information and direction from the Office of the Superintendent of Instruction (OSPI) on continuous learning. Please know, we will continue to work hard and provide the best education possible for our students.

Take care,

Ben Ferney

post_text:
March 20, 2020 Extended School Closure Update

Only essential staff were on campus today making plans for the extended closure. Updates for today:

‚Ä¢ Today, we served meals in the Valley Bus Loop and the Valley Grange from 9:00-11:00 am. A total of 178 meals were handed out!
‚Ä¢ We have compiled the meal service phone call survey data from yesterday and starting on Monday will be using district vehicles on three routes to bring meals to students‚Äô homes. Families will be contacted and given an estimated delivery time (please flexible as it is our first day trying this). The map is posted on the website.
‚Ä¢ If you are a family who needs a meal service for school-age children, and did not get called in the phone survey, please call us at 509-937-4021 for support.

The District Leadership Team met today and worked through the meal service program and continue to explore extended learning opportunities. Have a great weekend!

Ben Ferney, Superintendent
text:
March 20, 2020 Extended School Closure Update

Only essential staff were on campus today making plans for the extended closure. Updates for today:

‚Ä¢ Today, we served meals in the Valley Bus Loop and the Valley Grange from 9:00-11:00 am. A total of 178 meals were handed out!
‚Ä¢ We have compiled the meal service phone call survey data from yesterday and starting on Monday will be using district vehicles on three routes to bring meals to students‚Äô homes. Families will be contacted and given an estimated delivery time (please flexible as it is our first day trying this). The map is posted on the website.
‚Ä¢ If you are a family who needs a meal service for school-age children, and did not get called in the phone survey, please call us at 509-937-4021 for support.

The District Leadership Team met today and worked through the meal service program and continue to explore extended learning opportunities. Have a great weekend!

Ben Ferney, Superintendent

post_text:
CHILDCARE ANNOUNCEMENT

Governor Inslee has directed schools to provide childcare to health service personnel and first responders, if you fall into either of these two categories, have students currently enrolled in Valley School District ages 3-13, and need childcare during the closure, please contact Candace Harris at 937-2638 to complete an intake.

Please know that we will do our very best to provide care to all eligible families, as long as we are able to do so. Please utilize alternate childcare options and consider this school option as a last resort. Our target date to contact you to let you know when we can start services is in the afternoon on Monday, March 23rd.

Who is a First Responder?
Those working in law enforcement, as a paramedic, or the fire department.

Who is an eligible health service worker?
Those working for a facility that provides medical care (including at nursing homes/assisted living facilities) a doctor‚Äôs office, or a hospital.

post_text:
Valley School District Families and Staff,

Today is March 15th and it is approximately 7:00 p.m. This is Superintendent Ben Ferney.

As the afternoon has evolved things have changed. It is with a heavy heart that I share with you that effective immediately Valley School District has cancelled school starting Monday March 16th. Despite the message that you received earlier today, we will not be having school tomorrow.

We apologize for the conflicting information but please realize that the district is making decisions as information becomes available.

The school buildings will be open to pick up medication and personal items. We will only have essential staff report to school tomorrow: the District Leadership Team, business office, facilities staff and secretaries.

Further communication will be coming that will help answer many of the questions you may have.

We will all get through this together.
text:
Valley School District Families and Staff,

Today is March 15th and it is approximately 7:00 p.m. This is Superintendent Ben Ferney.

As the afternoon has evolved things have changed. It is with a heavy heart that I share with you that effective immediately Valley School District has cancelled school starting Monday March 16th. Despite the message that you received earlier today, we will not be having school tomorrow.

We apologize for the conflicting information but please realize that the district is making decisions as information becomes available.

The school buildings will be open to pick up medication and personal items. We will only have essential staff report to school tomorrow: the District Leadership Team, business office, facilities staff and secretaries.

Further communication will be coming that will help answer many of the questions you may have.

We will all get through this together.

post_text:
Our priority is to maintain the safety of our students, staff, and community. This pandemic remains fluid with new information coming out daily so updates will be communicated often. Thank you for your patience as we navigate these challenging times together. The following bullets outline our plan moving into the week:
‚Ä¢ Paideia High School is on a regular schedule for Monday, March 16
‚Ä¢ Valley School has a professional development day on Monday, March 16 (no students)
‚Ä¢ Valley Early Learning Center is on a regular schedule for Monday, March 16
‚Ä¢ Parents/guardians may pick up medications and personal items on Monday, March 16
‚Ä¢ Valley School District will be closed starting Tuesday, March 17
‚Ä¢ We are planning to provide a sack breakfast and sack lunch with a targeted start date on Monday, March 23
‚Ä¢ Childcare for medical professionals and first responders target start date is Monday, March 23
‚Ä¢ Optional learning opportunities are being explored and will be communicated when ready
‚Ä¢ Columbia Virtual Academy will continue to operate virtually

post_text: As you may be aware, Colville School District is closed today due to a suspected case of COVID-19. Valley School District has been following the cleaning protocol guidelines from NE Tri County Health and the Washington State Department of Health. Based on concerns in our county, we are now taking additional disinfecting measures of our facilities including busing. On February 26th, NE Tri County Health released a news statement that can found on our website under ‚ÄúDistrict News‚Äù. We will continue to work with NE Tri County Health and follow any additional recommendations. The safety of our students and staff is our highest priority.

post_text: A community member stopped by Valley School and reported a cougar and cub on Lane Mountain Property near the school around 11:45 am. The school district went into a district-wide lockout and kept students and staff inside. Fish and Wildlife responded and cleared the area around 12:50 pm. The safety of our students and staff is our highest priority and we thank Fish and Wildlife for their response.
text: A community member stopped by Valley School and reported a cougar and cub on Lane Mountain Property near the school around 11:45 am. The school district went into a district-wide lockout and kept students and staff inside. Fish and Wildlife responded and cleared the area around 12:50 pm. The safety of our students and staff is our highest priority and we thank Fish and Wildlife for their response.

post_text: Valley School District is seeking applicants for a Facilities Supervisor, a Long-Term Substitute High School Teacher at Paideia High School, HS Para-Part-time Temporary, Elementary Teacher for 2020-2021 and Substitute Maintenance Staff. Details are on the website at https://www.valleysd.org/domain/49

post_text: An update to the message about the Valley Bus slide off. All students that were on Valley Bus 8 have been released to their parents or guardians.
text: An update to the message about the Valley Bus slide off. All students that were on Valley Bus 8 have been released to their parents or guardians.

post_text: This afternoon, on the pm route, Valley School Bus #8 slid on its side off the road. Emergency services and district resources responded. There were no major injuries and only one minor injury. Medical staff has released or is releasing all students to parents or guardians The safety of our students is our primary concern and we thank the emergency responders for their assistance.
text: This afternoon, on the pm route, Valley School Bus #8 slid on its side off the road. Emergency services and district resources responded. There were no major injuries and only one minor injury. Medical staff has released or is releasing all students to parents or guardians The safety of our students is our primary concern and we thank the emergency responders for their assistance.

post_text: Due to weather conditions Valley School District schools will start late on Monday January 13th. Valley K8 and Valley Early Learning Center will be one hour late, starting at 10:40 am. Paideia High School will be two-hours late starting at 10:40 am. Buses will be late and breakfast will not be served. District Office and CVA Staff are advised to arrive as soon as it is safe to do so.

post_text:
Valley School District is introducing a new mass communication tool to provide staff, parents and guardians informational and emergency messages. You are receiving this test email because you are listed as staff. In addition to this email, we are calling and sending a text message. Please be aware:

‚Ä¢ You may initially need to check for emails in your spam or junk folder.
‚Ä¢ Any phone number/email changes need to be made through Human Resources.

We‚Äôll be rolling out the new system this month and expect all schools to be using it by Thanksgiving.

Thank you!

post_text:
Valley School District is introducing a new mass communication tool to provide you informational and emergency messages. You are receiving this test email because you are listed as a parent or guardian of a student. In addition to this email, we are calling and sending a text message. Please be aware:

‚Ä¢ You may initially need to check for emails in your spam or junk folder.
‚Ä¢ Unlike our old system, we will now be sending informational messages to all the people listed as parents or guardians on your student‚Äôs record in Skyward.
‚Ä¢ Any phone number/email changes need to be made through your school office.

We‚Äôll be rolling out the new system this month and expect all schools to be using it by Thanksgiving.

Thank you!

shared_text:
Valley Early Learning Center
September 25, 2019 at 3:12 PM ¬∑

Attention All ‚ÄòDADS‚Äô of
Valley School Students!

‚ÄòDads and Kids‚Äô Pizza Night Event!
FREE Pizza, Drinks and Fun!

Fathers and Father-figures,

On October 15th from 5:30 p.m. to 6:30 p.m. we will be having our 1st annual ‚ÄòDads and Kids‚Äô Pizza Night at our school. You will meet here in the Multi-Purpose Room at 5:30 p.m. for FREE pizza and drinks. At 6:00 p.m. we will have a presentation about our WATCH D.O.G.S. ¬Æ (Dads Of Great Students) Program. WATCH D.O.G.S. ¬Æ is an innovative program being used by schools across America which helps them to be positively impacted by the committed involvement of fathers and father-figures in their student‚Äôs life. Our goal is to have you spend at least one day this year at the school to be a positive male role model and to provide an extra set of eyes and ears.

Dads, granddads, uncles, step-dads and adult brothers . . . this is your chance to have a night out alone with your student in a fun atmosphere at school.

Call Candace to sign up! 509-937-2638 or email candace.harris@velc.org

The Stevens County Sheriff‚Äôs Office is reporting a large land line phone outage effecting Chewelah, Kettle Falls, Hunters, and Inchelium. This outage also impacts the Valley School District. Valley School
December 17, 2018 at 6:04 AM ¬∑

Due to icy road conditions, the Valley School District and buses will be running with a two hour delay today, Monday, December 17th. Because this is a regular Monday Late Start Day, Valley K-8 and the Valley Preschool ECAP Program will be starting at 10:40 a.m. Child Care will start at regular time. Paideia High School will Start at 10:40 a.m. as well. No breakfast will be served.

The Valley K-8 Music Concert will proceed as planned starting at 2:00 p.m. today. Bus sadly, Santa is a very busy person and will have to reschedule his visit with the Valley School..

If you have any questions, please call your school office. Thank you and please be safe!

post_text: Valley School is always looking for ways to encourage students to do their best at school. Two activities we use are Quarterly Award Assemblies and the ASB Fund Run. The Family Engagement Committee has requested that we study our award assemblies and fund run to see if they benefit student learning. Should you have any questions about this survey please contact Candace Harris at 937-2638.

STEM Camp day 3! Thank you so much to everyone for bringing your children down to camp. It would not be possible without community participation and the excellent staff of Valley School District! A special THANK YOU to Kenny Rindlisbacher, Misty Larson, and Makayla Rindlisbacher for putting this camp together. It was a blast!

post_text:
PUBLIC NOTICE
VALLEY SCHOOL DISTRICT 070, Stevens County, Washington, is completing preparation of the 2018-2019 FISCAL BUDGET and four-year budget plan. The completed budget and four-year budget plan will be on file in the Valley School District Administrative Office located at 3030 Huffman Road, Valley, WA 99181 on June 26, 2018. A copy of the budget and four-year budget plan will be furnished to any person who might request such. Also, let it be known to all persons that the Board of Directors of VALLEY SCHOOL DISTRICT 070, STEVENS COUNTY, WASHINGTON, will hold a public hearing Wednesday, July 11, 2018 at 6:45 p.m. at the Valley School District Administrative Office for the purpose of fixing and adopting the 2018-2019 FISCAL BUDGET of the District. Any interested persons may appear at this meeting and will be given the opportunity to be heard for or against any part of the proposed 2018-2019 FISCAL BUDGET, the four-year budget plan or any proposed changes to the uses of enrichment funding. All inquiries regarding this notice should be directed to Eileen Harris at 937-2791.

post_text: The Valley School District Board of Directors is pleased to announce that, at the March 21st Board meeting, Mr. Ben Ferney was hired to succeed our retiring superintendent, Mr. Kevin Foster. Mr. Ferney, a Washington State University graduate, has taught in the Spokane and Cheney Public Schools. Currently, he is the principal at Freeman Middle School and will complete the WSU Superintendent Certification Program in June of this year. Mr. Ferney will assume the duties as Valley School District Superintendent on July 1, 2018. Please join us in welcoming Ben to the Valley School District.
text: The Valley School District Board of Directors is pleased to announce that, at the March 21st Board meeting, Mr. Ben Ferney was hired to succeed our retiring superintendent, Mr. Kevin Foster. Mr. Ferney, a Washington State University graduate, has taught in the Spokane and Cheney Public Schools. Currently, he is the principal at Freeman Middle School and will complete the WSU Superintendent Certification Program in June of this year. Mr. Ferney will assume the duties as Valley School District Superintendent on July 1, 2018. Please join us in welcoming Ben to the Valley School District.

post_text:
Substitute Bus Drivers Needed!

Are you a stay at home parent with kids in school? Would you like something part-time while they are gone? Need some extra income, while still being there for the kids? Student Transportation may be for you! Valley and Loon Lake schools are in need of Substitute Bus Drivers.

Training is provided for CDL class B with passenger/school bus endorsements. Training paid upon completion. Qualified applicants must be able to pass a DOT physical, drug screen and fingerprint background check. Call for information: 509-937-4021 or pick up an application at VL Transport Center at Highway 395 and Bulldog Creek Rd. You could be just who we are looking for!
